perturbation.original_text: The Company agrees that, concurrent with the appointment of the New Directors to the Board, the Board shall take such action as is necessary such that each of the New Directors is appointed to at least one (1) of the three (3) standing committees of the Board that the Company is required to maintain in accordance with the NASDAQ listing standards; provided that, with respect to each such committee appointment, the New Director is and continues to remain eligible to serve as a member of such committee pursuant to applicable law and the rules of NASDAQ that are applicable to the composition of such committee.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company will endeavor to appoint the New Directors to a committee, as it deems feasible. The Company will consider the NASDAQ listing standards when making committee appointments, if practical.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text replaces 'shall take such action as is necessary' with 'will endeavor to appoint,' weakening the obligation. 'As it deems feasible' introduces subjective criteria for committee appointments. Replacing 'is required to maintain in accordance with the NASDAQ listing standards' with 'will consider the NASDAQ listing standards when making committee appointments, if practical' provides room for non-compliance. This introduces ambiguity regarding compliance with NASDAQ requirements for committee composition, potentially violating those standards which require specific committees and independent directors. This conflicts with the requirements of NASDAQ, which requires that listed companies maintain specific committees and that those committees meet certain requirements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: NASDAQ Listing Rules regarding Board Committees

perturbation.original_text: At each annual and special meeting of stockholders held prior to the expiration of the Standstill Period (as defined below), each of the Investors agrees to (A) appear at such stockholders' meeting or otherwise cause all shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by each Investor and their respective Affiliates and Associates (as defined below) to be counted as present thereat for purposes of establishing a quorum; (B) vote, or cause to be voted, all shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by each Investor and their respective Affiliates and Associates on the Company's proxy card or voting instruction form in favor of each of the nominees for election as directors nominated by the Board and recommended by the Board (and not in favor of any other nominees to serve on the Board); and, except in connection with any Opposition Matter (as defined below) or Other Voting Recommendation (as defined below), each of the proposals listed on the Company's proxy card or voting instruction form as identified in the Company's definitive proxy statement or supplement thereto in accordance with the Board's recommendations, including in favor of all matters recommended by the Board for stockholder approval and against all matters which the Board recommends against stockholder approval; provided, however, in the event that Institutional Shareholder Services Inc. ('ISS') issues a recommendation with respect to any matter (other than with respect to the election of nominees as directors to the Board or the removal of directors from the Board) that is different from the recommendation of the Board, each of the Investors shall have the right to vote on the Company's proxy card or voting instruction form in accordance with the ISS recommendation (the 'Other Voting Recommendation'); and (C) not execute any proxy card or voting instruction form in respect of such stockholders' meeting other than the proxy card and related voting instruction form being solicited by or on behalf of the Company or the Board.
perturbation.changed_text: At each annual and special meeting of stockholders, each of the Investors should endeavor to (A) ensure their shares are counted for quorum purposes; (B) generally vote in favor of the Board's nominees, absent unusual circumstances; and (C) typically use the Company's proxy card.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'agrees to' is replaced by 'should endeavor to', making the voting commitment non-binding. 'Absent unusual circumstances' adds a broad exception to voting in favor of the Board's nominees, providing an easy opt-out. 'Typically use the Company’s proxy card' is vague. The original text provided clear direction and obligations, whereas the new text makes compliance voluntary. Under Delaware law, shareholders have a fiduciary duty to act in the best interests of the corporation when exerting control. By making the voting agreement non-binding, the provision might allow investors to take actions that are not aligned with the company's best interests, thus potentially violating their duties under Delaware corporate law. Shareholders agreements for voting on specific items require specific compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Delaware General Corporation Law regarding fiduciary duties of shareholders.

perturbation.original_text: Each Investor agrees that, from the date of this Agreement until the expiration of the Standstill Period (as defined below), without the prior written consent of a majority of the Board specifically expressed in a written resolution, neither it nor any of its Related Persons (as defined herein) will, and it will cause each of its Related Persons not to, directly or indirectly, alone or with others, in any manner: ... (iii) acquire, offer or propose to acquire, or agree to acquire, directly or indirectly, whether by purchase, tender or exchange offer, through the acquisition of control of another person, by joining a partnership, limited partnership, syndicate or other group (including any group of persons that would be treated as a single 'person' under Section 13(d) of the Exchange Act), through swap or hedging transactions or otherwise, any additional securities (including common and preferred equity interests and debt that is convertible into any equity interests) of the Company or any rights decoupled from the underlying securities of the Company, that would result, or could result, in the Investor Group owning, in the aggregate (amongst all of the Investors and any Affiliate or Associate thereof), in excess of 10% of the shares of Common Stock outstanding;
perturbation.changed_text: Each Investor agrees that, from the date of this Agreement until the expiration of the Standstill Period, they will generally not acquire additional securities that could substantially increase their ownership beyond 10%, unless unforeseen circumstances arise. The determination of what constitutes a substantial increase will be left to the Investor’s discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'will generally not acquire' weakens the restriction on acquiring additional securities. The phrase 'unless unforeseen circumstances arise' provides a broad and subjective exception. 'The determination of what constitutes a substantial increase will be left to the Investor’s discretion' introduces more subjectivity and allows investors to potentially increase their ownership significantly, thereby undermining the purpose of the standstill provision and circumventing the regulations enforced by the SEC related to disclosure and control of company stock.
perturbation.contradicted_law: SEC regulations regarding beneficial ownership reporting (Section 13(d) of the Exchange Act)
